ratings.comment: Billy Jackson was a decent professor. He is getting a lot of hate on here from people who, in my opinion, didn't study and/or are just not that good at math. All of the exams were fair. If you did the review guide at all and kept up with the homework, the course shouldn't have been hard. Sorry if this was blunt, but it is the truth. Sorry.

The best thing that I can say about this professor is that the exams are quite like the exam review, but other than that, his teaching style and the way he taught this already difficult course is terrible. There is no curve in this class, the homework is tough with no answer key to review. The exams are difficult and made harder than needed.

If you have the chance to not take this professor, DONT. I had an ok TA and did well on homework and overall quizzes. I never met Billy Jackson and think the class has incredibly complicated and in depth content for first semester Algebra class. Much of the content I had friends in Calc 2/ tested out of math, be unable to assist with content. 0/10

Jackson is fine.  Stuff on exams is basically stuff we do in lectures.  Go to class and you're fine as long as you remember the stuff from Calc 2 and calc 3 .  Class can be a bit dry at times but between the homework which 45% of the grad which he helps with when you ask him and the easy exams, the class is pretty easy.

I have basically had to teach myself this entire course. The lectures make no sense, the homework has no answer keys so the grading is unfair and no feedback is given. Dont take this class, if you have to, find a different professor.

Professor Jackson embodies the Socratic method in his teaching. His exam reviews are helpful and indicative of the exam. His writing is illegible sometimes, but makes up for it with how much he talks in lecture. He has a passion for teaching and it shows in how he answers questions during lecture and office hours. I recommend Billy Jackson 100%

I have done quite well in his 321 class.  He gives you lots of chances to practice in class.  Overall the reviews have prepared me for the exams pretty well --if you can do the problems in the reviews you can do his exams.  Takes things a bit slow at times but it helps to learn it.
graded unfairly, sets students up for failure.

This is the worst class I have taken at UWM. 
*unorganized
*unfair grading
*no feedback is given on homework's
*no answer keys
*no resources
*difficult to read handwriting
*unhelpful office hours
*unhelpful TA
*unresponsive on piazza and in emails
*unprofessional
Overall, I am very displeased with this professor and this class.

Billy is the overall Professor for my class, but the class is actually taught by a TA. I had two different TA's throughout the semester and both were not great. All of the resources and notes you get for the class are not helpful. The notes we do in class are almost all writing instead of practice problems. There are quizzes two days of the week.

Compared to what I've heard about the other instructors that teach Math 112, I don't think Billy Jackson was HORRIBLE. He obviously knows what he's talking about. There are quizzes twice a week which forces you to attend class. The third exam is a (very easy) group exam which boosted my grade. Overall, not an amazing instructor, but not the worst.
he does not explain his teaching. he does not care for students. be prepared to teach yourself.

GRADING FOR TA MAYA BANKS!!!

She is the nicest person ever, connects to the students, and understands what the students are going through. She gets blindsided by Billy Jackson but does her best. She makes sure her students know what is going on. Such a fun TA
He does not care for the students or the TAs. The work compared to the exams is not connected. This was the worst class I have ever taken. I would not recommend.
He is bad

Combination of lectures and us getting to practice and discuss things on our own. I have been to class every day and there is always at least one if not two opportunities for us to practice on our own and I like this because it helps me do the homework.  Two quizzes each work which helps with exams and very fast so be careful not to get behind.

Billy Jackson claimed the first day of class he was going to do interactive learning. I was excited because I am not the best at math and need help a lot. Well, this happened rarely. The lectures are too fast paced and his handwriting is absolutely ineligible. The textbook does not help with understanding concepts. Worst math class I've ever taken.

Dr. Jackson does not care about his students whatsoever. If you are sick or have to miss class for any reason, it's basically good luck and you get a zero. He is only interested in doing what's easiest for himself and CLEARLY does not care about the success or wellbeing of any of his students. Overall, avoid this class at all costs.
Awful

Doesn't believe in standard lectures. Work in groups for most of the class, what you learn is often reliant on what your group collectively knows. At least two homework assignments on the online textbook a week. You have a quiz every class (group and individual). He's somewhat helpful, but he understands the content too well to use layman's terms.

Overall, Professor Jackson knows the concepts of the content well, and he teaches them adequately. However, the exams are a bit more difficult than I anticipated initially, but he provided study guides that covered most topics. Talk to your TAs, they helped a lot in the class!

This class was really hard for me. The way the lectures were set up was very odd and I wasnt able to learn very well with his teaching style. The homework was online and sometimes super long and had things on it that I didnt see during the class lesson and had to teach myself. The exams were more straight forward than the homework though.

I took Jackson for Math 240. Grade is approx 40% participation/easy weekly quizzes and 60% tough, proof based exams. Lectures emphasize practicing concepts which is nice. He makes reviews for each exam and very active on piazza. This is a tough class, especially with the math department, but Jackson makes if doable. Just study A LOT for the exams.

Jackson was my professor, but didn't actually teach. My TA Krenz - incapable of teaching. Billy was good and helpful for office hours. I had covid and he was not helpful, I missed a quiz and got a zero and was told there was nothing they could do about it. They also said they couldn't accommodate me at all while in quarantine. I don't recommend.

He worked as the director chair of the course but the actual class was run by incapable TAs. I recommend reading the textbook chapters before going to the lecture. Billy is actually helpful during office hours and cares more about understanding the concept. Although the real issue is the disorganization of the course

As others have said, his reviews are just like the exams IF you know the stuff in the reviews.  He does change the problems on the exam but the problems are the same ideas as in the reviews, so just giving back his solutions is not an option.  I found when I missed class I missed like weeks worth of material.  Get ready to do PROOFs in 240.

I did not take Math 114 with him, but Math 240. His lectures can be hard to follow and the exams are a lot more difficult than the homework, some of the problems that are on the exams aren't even on the review. Whenever someone asks a question, his answers can be ambiguous and are not that good at clarifying concepts or any misunderstandings.

One of the best largest lecture courses I have had. Makes the class interesting and doesn't just talk the full 75 minutes but gives chances to practice (usually-- though there have been times class would drag on).  Grade is exams, quizzes, final, and homeworks (which come from textbook for 240 that sucks in a lot of ways).Definitely worth taking

Overall I think he is a decent prof. I personally thought the class was really easy, he goes over problems on the board. The study guides are legit the exact same as the midterms/ final exam. you get weekly homework and sometimes there are legit like 70 problems for you to do, but it is easy to get 100 on them but takes awhile sometimes.

Dr. Jackson was great!  We spent a lot of class time reviewing how to actually work the problems and prepare for the homework.  I wish I could have him for 221 -- it would make things so much easier.  I passed his class easily but now 221 is tough because my professor can't explain things at all in ways that normal human beings can understand.

He clearly has no desire to teach. All he kept doing the entire semester was talk about his paper he is writing and talk to the guys in the class. We had to do it his way and it wasnt explained well. He gives handouts and doesnt teach. The tests are so much harder than the homework. The only way I passed was with tutoring and he offered no help.

Jackson is ok. You have to know your algebra because he focuses just on the trig. If you have been used to using calculators to do things like graphing, it can be a bit challenging to adjust to having to do it by hand without them. That said, he does help you learn how to do the problems without them but it takes a while to remember the algebra.

I have always enjoyed math and been ok at it but this class made me hate everything. He focuses on the why of math instead of how to actually do the problem so it's hard to apply to tests, especially since there is nothing to practice. His practice tests are the same as the exam which helps, although the answer key tends to have many mistakes.

Hes fine. Its a math class so exams and homework will of course make up the grade. If you go to class and actually do the work the homework and exams are not an issue. I have always been scared of math but he makes math less scary. If you go through the reviews and go to his office you can get by pretty easily.

Billy Jackson moves through material very fast and isnt a very understanding professor. Your grades are based solely off homework and exams, there are no quizzes to practice the concepts before they are weighted more heavily. No matter how many reviews or office hours you go to, Dr. Jackson will not be understanding of your struggles in his class.

If you put in the work, youll do fine as long as you know your algebra already. He doesnt review a whole lot of algebra since its trig. So if you dont know your algebra, be ready to put in the time to review it for yourself. Unfortunately there were too many people in the groups who didnt know their algebra and it hurt the group work.

barely a professor - lectures are youtube videos done by a different prof., & there is no encouragement to ask questions or to retain the information. instruction is not given to ta's as to what to include for lectures which results in a widely unprepared student body for tests and quizzes. also required in-person test during omicron spike.

probably the most insensitive person at this school. he does not care about the well-being of the students. he wasnt my direct professor but he was the department chair of the class i took. he required 600+ individuals to take an exam in person during the omicron spike.

dont take this prof. worst prof ive ever had. dude cant teach. expects you to just know things. exams are worth 75% of grade. exams dont correlate to hw. randomly takes assignments down. very disorganized. never available for help. doesnt answer emails. has 1 star rating at every other institution.

I LOVED having Dr. Jackson this semester! Like the majority of people taking this class, I was putting off taking Calc 221 until next semester, but Dr. Jackson has definitely made me feel a lot more prepared for it. It's a math class, it's obviously going to be homework / exam heavy, but I think the other reviews are dead wrong. Billy is amazing.

this class was actually horrible. the lectures are online, so it is hard to get clarity on the lecture content. there is not a variety of practice problems given. the tests and quizzes are almost nothing like the lecture content. very easy to get lost, but if you can teach yourself or took algebra in high school you might be okay.

this class sucks. you have to watch the lecture and take notes on your own and the actual classes are a waste of time. the tests are really hard and don't compare to the in class discussion at all. not accommodating either.

You take notes by yourself before discussion, in discussion you're given easy worksheets to complete with a group. However, homework is a lot more challenging. Reviews and tests are way harder and do not compare to discussion worksheets. Dr. J is not accommodating of alternate exams. To top everything off all 3 of my exams were mis-graded.

Exams were pretty much like reviews which are mostly like the homework (except the ones you have to explain). Two homeworks were longer, but he did tell about those ahead of time. If you're not about being in a math class at 4pm in the afternoon, then you shouldnt take him because missing a class feels like youve missed TWO WEEKS. Overall decent.

First day of class we were told we'd do interactive learning. At first I was open to the idea, but now I wish he would just lecture us. Barely any outside materials you can use to make up for the waste of time class is. You can't even read what he's writing. The homework was RIDICULOUSLY long. No, I don't want to solve a triangle 63 times.

I learned a lot but I personally didnt like the group work. I got stuck with a group who all had calculus in high school but they couldnt do the stuff we were supposed to be doing like the graphs. I learned way more just doing the problems on my own than I ever did from the group. Asking the TAs questions during class helps.

Dr. Jackson claimed on the first day that this class was not going to be lecture heavy. He proved this to be a complete lie. His lectures are hard to follow as you cannot read what he is writing. He also assigns 70 problem hws where if you get the answer wrong by a tiny decimal, you have to redo the problem a million times (doesnt help me learn)

Dr. J is an easy A. Sometimes he lectures, sometimes worksheets. It helps me because I dont like listening to lecture in a math class for 75 minutes. My high school geometry teacher sucked, so this class has helped a lot because he always explains things really well. BUT it can be annoying at times trying to help other people in your group.

Professor Jackson has made this course a lot more difficult than it needs to be. Class lectures are really confusing because he is very adamant about interactive learning yet continues to write sloppy work on the screens for us to copy down. It is hard to understand when he tries to explain the concepts while he is teaching. Thumbs down.

I'm torn. Professor Jackson means well, and he has complimented my achievements throughout the semester, but this course is unnecessarily difficult. I have a hard time with professors who require you to teach yourself the concepts. Let me put it simple, I shouldn't be paying top dollar at a renown university to end up teaching myself. Sorry Billy.

Dr. Jackson is ok. The class had a very high average on the first exam, and then people started skipping when they found out that his reviews are just like his exams. Like every math class, if you skip you won't pass. Unfortunately, too many people found this out the hard way on the 2nd exam and bombed it. For me, I passed it with a solid C.

billy is a great example of a prof who knows a lot but just cant teach. his lectures are so confusing that everyone stopped showing up and just watched the online videos. the hw does not correlate to the exams and he makes you explain the math and not just know how to do it. he is very disorganized and goes back and forth between material.

Dr. Jackson is definitely not the best professor I've ever had... I took Trig with him and he makes a 113 class way too complicated. Makes you proof/explain everything and does not let you use a calculator. Gives us "interactive" sheets to do throughout class but we don't finish them. Everyone bombed the first exam because the hw dont reflect exams

I like the guy, but lectures are quite weird. He sort of gives us a worksheet and tells us to do it. He sometimes lectures for almost the entire period and doesnt give us time for the worksheet that we are supposed to do there. No calculators. A lot of the hw is not what you need to know for exam. You also need to EXPLAIN the math & not just do it.
